title: Saul
summary: Saul (/sɔːl/; Hebrew: שָׁאוּל‎‎, romanized: Šāʾūl; Greek: Σαούλ; transl. "asked/prayed for"), according to the Hebrew Bible, was the first monarch of the United Kingdom of Israel. His reign, traditionally placed in the late 11th century BCE,[1] supposedly marked the transition of Israel and Judah from a scattered tribal society to organized statehood.[2]
